reviewText: The play was okay. I lost interest in some parts. It ended well but wasn't great. "When the light goes off" was better.

reviewText: Great cast! It's crazy to see Jermaine Crawford aka "Dukie" (from the Wire) all grown! The kid is a great actor and I'm looking forward to see more from him. Johnny Gill - Still sounds great! Great to see him again. The play itself was pretty good. The acting, singing, and underlying theme were strong. I would love to see this play in person with this same cast. Where they do that at?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love this movie but I found myself channel from this , when dad sing a longest song! It was the most boring part. I was about to get this movie until saw that they got a lot more songs just like Tyler Perry stage play. I can't handle it. It would be better off if they don't have all those songs. I am not trying sound rude, but it honest upon how this movie went (it actually is stage play) Yes, you can do anything thru Christ, that is what mentioned in movie. I love the movie's ending espically. I cried all the time seeing movie, it talks about how mother want children be home and she ask God she would do snything even if it mean her...then she got cancer. But later She is walking and better! I got up and dancing crying! I know the Lord can do it all! It is in His power

reviewText: This play has a little of everything in it (laughter, sadness, reality) and of course great singing.  If you are a Christian and have children, I would definitely recommend that you to watch this DVD.

reviewText: This is a very sad movie. When I saw the title I thought of the many times I prayed for the safety of my kids, and pre-judged the movie to be similar to that, but it turned out different. It's a good movie, just too sad for me.

reviewText: I was drawn to this DVD because of Johnny Gill and Jermaine Crawford (very curious about his role since i last seen him on The Wire) but I have to admit Shirley Murdock stole the show for me! To be honest I didn't really know who Shirley Murdock was but maaaaaaaaan that woman can sing! If you don't know, now you know!

reviewText: I saw the actual play and fell in love with the story! Everyone can relate to the struggles this family encounters. The singing is unbelievable (thank you Johnny Gill and Shirley Murdock) and the humor is sure to brighten your day. This play will open up your eyes and heart, and re-teach you some life lessons you've may have lost.
